title: Clef fails to sign transaction after accepting master password and not asking for any other password
body:
#### System information

Geth version: `geth version`
```
Geth
Version: 1.10.9-unstable
Git Commit: 9ada4a2e2c415e6b0b51c50e901336872e028872
Git Commit Date: 20210910
Architecture: amd64
Go Version: go1.17
Operating System: linux
GOPATH=
GOROOT=go
```
OS & Version: Ubuntu 20.04.3 LTS
Commit hash : (if `develop`)

#### Expected behaviour

Clef should request the password it needs for signing a transaction, or use the already accepted master password.

#### Actual behaviour

Clef reports it "could not decrypt key with given password" after accepting the master password and not asking for any other password.

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour

Create rules.js:
```
function ApproveListing() {
        return "Approve"
}

function ApproveTx(req) {
        if (req.transaction.to == "<target account>") {
                return "Approve"
        }
        if (req.transaction.to.toLowerCase() == "<target account in lower case>") {
                return "Approve"
        }
        return "Reject"
}
```
Attest rules.js:
```
$ sha256sum rules.js                 
<redacted hash>  rules.js
```
```
$ clef attest <redacted hash>

WARNING!                   
                                                                                               
Clef is an account management tool. It may, like any software, contain bugs.                                                                                                                   
                                                                                               
Please take care to                    
- backup your keystore files,
- verify that the keystore(s) can be opened with your password.     
                                                                                               
Clef is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY;
without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR
PURPOSE. See the GNU General Public License for more details.                                                                                                                                  

Enter 'ok' to proceed:
> ok                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
                                                                                               
Decrypt master seed of clef   
Password:                     
INFO [10-28|08:29:21.065] Ruleset attestation updated              sha256=<redacted hash>
```
Set the password in the keystore:
```
$ clef setpw "<redacted source account>"

WARNING!

Clef is an account management tool. It may, like any software, contain bugs.

Please take care to
- backup your keystore files,
- verify that the keystore(s) can be opened with your password.

Clef is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY;
without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR
PURPOSE. See the GNU General Public License for more details.

Enter 'ok' to proceed:
> ok

Please enter a password to store for this address:
Password: 
Repeat password: 

Decrypt master seed of clef
Password: 
INFO [10-28|08:43:07.707] Credential store updated                 set=<redacted source account>
```
Start clef signer:
```
$ clef --loglevel 6 --rules rules.js

WARNING!

Clef is an account management tool. It may, like any software, contain bugs.

Please take care to
- backup your keystore files,
- verify that the keystore(s) can be opened with your password.

Clef is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY;
without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR
PURPOSE. See the GNU General Public License for more details.

Enter 'ok' to proceed:
> ok

INFO [10-28|08:50:28.587] Using CLI as UI-channel 
INFO [10-28|08:50:28.798] Loaded 4byte database                    embeds=146,841 locals=0 local=./4byte-custom.json
## Master Password

Please enter the password to decrypt the master seed
> 
-----------------------
INFO [10-28|08:50:35.158] Rule engine configured                   file=rules.js
INFO [10-28|08:50:35.158] Starting signer                          chainid=1 keystore=/home/eth/.ethereum/keystore light-kdf=false advanced=false
DEBUG[10-28|08:50:35.158] FS scan times                            list="49.473µs" set="4.117µs" diff="2.225µs"
TRACE[10-28|08:50:35.158] Handled keystore changes                 time="42.31µs"
TRACE[10-28|08:50:35.158] Started watching keystore folder         path=/home/eth/.ethereum/keystore
DEBUG[10-28|08:50:35.159] Ledger support enabled 
DEBUG[10-28|08:50:35.160] Trezor support enabled via HID 
DEBUG[10-28|08:50:35.160] Trezor support enabled via WebUSB 
INFO [10-28|08:50:35.160] Smartcard socket file missing, disabling err="stat /run/pcscd/pcscd.comm: no such file or directory"
INFO [10-28|08:50:35.160] Audit logs configured                    file=audit.log
DEBUG[10-28|08:50:35.160] IPCs registered                          namespaces=account
INFO [10-28|08:50:35.160] IPC endpoint opened                      url=/home/eth/.clef/clef.ipc
------- Signer info -------
* intapi_version : 7.0.1
* extapi_version : 6.1.0
* extapi_http : n/a
* extapi_ipc : /home/eth/.clef/clef.ipc
INFO [10-28|08:50:35.168] error occurred during execution          error="ReferenceError: OnSignerStartup is not defined at <eval>:1:16(6)"
TRACE[10-28|08:51:04.180] Accepted RPC connection                  conn=@
INFO [10-28|08:51:04.187] Op approved 
ERROR[10-28|08:51:05.271] could not decrypt key with given password 
## Error 
could not decrypt key with given password
-------------------------------------------
WARN [10-28|08:51:05.271] Served account_signTransaction           reqid=6 t=1.090267141s             err="could not decrypt key with given password"
^CINFO [10-28|08:51:31.755] Exiting...                               signal=interrupt
INFO [10-28|08:51:31.755] IPC endpoint closed                      url=/home/eth/.clef/clef.ipc
```
Run a geth node:
```
$ geth --maxpeers 25 --cache 16384 --verbosity 3 --signer=/home/eth/.clef/clef.ipc --http
...
WARN [10-28|08:51:05.271] Served eth_sendTransaction               reqid=9  t=1.09852128s  err="could not decrypt key with given password"
...
```
Run interactive geth:
```
$ geth attach ipc:/home/eth/.ethereum/geth.ipc
Welcome to the Geth JavaScript console!

instance: Geth/v1.10.9-unstable-9ada4a2e-20210910/linux-amd64/go1.17
coinbase: <redacted source account>
at block: 13504195 (Thu Oct 28 2021 08:50:09 GMT+0200 (CEST))
 datadir: /home/eth/.ethereum
 modules: admin:1.0 debug:1.0 eth:1.0 ethash:1.0 miner:1.0 net:1.0 personal:1.0 rpc:1.0 txpool:1.0 web3:1.0

To exit, press ctrl-d
> eth.sendTransaction({from:"<redacted source account>",to: "<redacted target account>", value:"<redacted amount>", maxFeePerGas: "70000000000", gas: "0x5208"})
Error: could not decrypt key with given password
        at web3.js:6357:37(47)
        at web3.js:5091:62(37)
        at <eval>:1:20(14)

>
```

#### Backtrace

````
[backtrace]
````

When submitting logs: please submit them as text and not screenshots.

I can't repro this... 

Init clef
```
$ clef --suppress-bootwarn --advanced  --configdir ./config  --keystore ./keystore init 
The master seed of clef will be locked with a password.
Please specify a password. Do not forget this password!
Password: 
Repeat password: 

A master seed has been generated into config/masterseed.json

This is required to be able to store credentials, such as:
* Passwords for keystores (used by rule engine)
* Storage for JavaScript auto-signing rules
* Hash of JavaScript rule-file

You should treat 'masterseed.json' with utmost secrecy and make a backup of it!
* The password is necessary but not enough, you need to back up the master seed too!
* The master seed does not contain your accounts, those need to be backed up separately!

```
Attest rules: 
```
[user@work cleftest]$ sha256sum rules.js 
4d4a6ed200de163af2110a8fdd6609ba431bfeada04d80ebed94313cf9662c1a  rules.js
[user@work cleftest]$ clef --suppress-bootwarn --advanced  --configdir ./config  --keystore ./keystore  attest 4d4a6ed200de163af2110a8fdd6609ba431bfeada04d80ebed94313cf9662c1a
Decrypt master seed of clef
Password: 
INFO [10-28|11:59:48.996] Ruleset attestation updated              sha256=4d4a6ed200de163af2110a8fdd6609ba431bfeada04d80ebed94313cf9662c1a
```
Create a new key
```
$ geth --keystore ./keystore account new
INFO [10-28|12:01:29.730] Maximum peer count                       ETH=50 LES=0 total=50
INFO [10-28|12:01:29.731] Smartcard socket not found, disabling    err="stat /run/pcscd/pcscd.comm: no such file or directory"
Your new account is locked with a password. Please give a password. Do not forget this password.
Password: 
Repeat password: 

Your new key was generated

Public address of the key:   0xEb4f78a84d72d3A88db32a7BeD7652D297D05036
Path of the secret key file: /home/user/tmp/cleftest/keystore/UTC--2021-10-28T10-01-33.610741827Z--eb4f78a84d72d3a88db32a7bed7652d297d05036

- You can share your public address with anyone. Others need it to interact with you.
- You must NEVER share the secret key with anyone! The key controls access to your funds!
- You must BACKUP your key file! Without the key, it's impossible to access account funds!
- You must REMEMBER your password! Without the password, it's impossible to decrypt the key!
```
Store the password in clef
```
$ clef --suppress-bootwarn --advanced  --configdir ./config  --keystore ./keystore  setpw 0xEb4f78a84d72d3A88db32a7BeD7652D297D05036
Please enter a password to store for this address:
Password: 
Repeat password: 

Decrypt master seed of clef
Password: 
INFO [10-28|12:03:07.652] Credential store updated                 set=0xEb4f78a84d72d3A88db32a7BeD7652D297D05036
```

This error shows, but it doesn't matter - just a callback that isn't implemented in the rules: 
```
INFO [10-28|12:03:58.341] error occurred during execution          error="ReferenceError: OnSignerStartup is not defined at <eval>:1:16(6)"
```
Start geth:
```
user@work cleftest]$ geth --nodiscover --maxpeers 0 --signer ./config/clef.ipc console
INFO [10-28|12:05:17.861] Starting Geth on Ethereum mainnet... 
INFO [10-28|12:05:17.861] Bumping default cache on mainnet         provided=1024 updated=4096
INFO [10-28|12:05:17.863] Maximum peer count                       ETH=0 LES=0 total=0
INFO [10-28|12:05:17.863] Smartcard socket not found, disabling    err="stat /run/pcscd/pcscd.comm: no such file or directory"
INFO [10-28|12:05:17.863] Using external signer                    url=./config/clef.ipc
...
Welcome to the Geth JavaScript console!

instance: Geth/v1.10.10-unstable-897f07a7-20211019/linux-amd64/go1.17
coinbase: 0xeb4f78a84d72d3a88db32a7bed7652d297d05036
at block: 648435 (Sun Dec 06 2015 06:35:46 GMT+0100 (CET))
 datadir: /home/user/.ethereum
 modules: admin:1.0 debug:1.0 eth:1.0 ethash:1.0 miner:1.0 net:1.0 personal:1.0 rpc:1.0 txpool:1.0 web3:1.0

To exit, press ctrl-d or type exit
```
And sign a transaction 
```
> eth.accounts
["0xeb4f78a84d72d3a88db32a7bed7652d297d05036"]
> eth.signTransaction({from: eth.accounts[0], to: eth.accounts[0], gasPrice: 1, gas: 200, nonce: 123})
{
  raw: "0xf85e7b0181c894eb4f78a84d72d3a88db32a7bed7652d297d05036808025a09f39db41873fcbce351563208e87ad9642c581d6cd733120140a4c9f9091f85da024fb5f94ef39ccc9e9647f83b0b48bd594abf496795a53032e361be753da82f5",
  tx: {
    gas: "0xc8",
    gasPrice: "0x1",
    hash: "0xd1ad42ae46add3181736c7f4df156f1b5d8b5e236136c4d6a7639ded198e8096",
    input: "0x",
    maxFeePerGas: null,
    maxPriorityFeePerGas: null,
    nonce: "0x7b",
    r: "0x9f39db41873fcbce351563208e87ad9642c581d6cd733120140a4c9f9091f85d",
    s: "0x24fb5f94ef39ccc9e9647f83b0b48bd594abf496795a53032e361be753da82f5",
    to: "0xeb4f78a84d72d3a88db32a7bed7652d297d05036",
    type: "0x0",
    v: "0x25",
    value: "0x0"
  }
}

```
I also tested adding one more account, with a different password, and it worked too: 
```
> eth.accounts
["0xeb4f78a84d72d3a88db32a7bed7652d297d05036", "0xff6772a0cec677747025b93ab42a2dec77e7aff4"]
> eth.signTransaction({from: eth.accounts[1], to: eth.accounts[1], gasPrice: 1, gas: 200, nonce: 123})
{
  raw: "0xf85e7b0181c894ff6772a0cec677747025b93ab42a2dec77e7aff4808025a0ba7bdcffd988b814d4f79658e2223543468eca378a8b916c73472f210a1fd7b3a04354e2c90cadb2f6c1b8b85d4599889544bb5f3698c4144160c59cc9c21336eb",
  tx: {
    gas: "0xc8",
    gasPrice: "0x1",
    hash: "0x2ee936881b928c88bae3de967caf54554ebca3e2adcb6d9d896f6a7f916d91b7",
    input: "0x",
    maxFeePerGas: null,
    maxPriorityFeePerGas: null,
    nonce: "0x7b",
    r: "0xba7bdcffd988b814d4f79658e2223543468eca378a8b916c73472f210a1fd7b3",
    s: "0x4354e2c90cadb2f6c1b8b85d4599889544bb5f3698c4144160c59cc9c21336eb",
    to: "0xff6772a0cec677747025b93ab42a2dec77e7aff4",
    type: "0x0",
    v: "0x25",
    value: "0x0"
  }
}
```
You could try, locally, to print out what key clef is trying to use on the key. Might be that you stored the wrong password? Just don't post any logs here :)

This issue has been automatically closed because there has been no response to our request for more information from the original author. With only the information that is currently in the issue, we don't have enough information to take action. Please reach out if you have more relevant information or answers to our questions so that we can investigate further.
@daosvik could you please address Martin's questions?

This issue has been automatically closed because there has been no response to our request for more information from the original author. With only the information that is currently in the issue, we don't have enough information to take action. Please reach out if you have more relevant information or answers to our questions so that we can investigate further.
Heh, good bot, don't listen to Guillaume!
looks like Guillaume won't listen to the bot either

This issue has been automatically closed because there has been no response to our request for more information from the original author. With only the information that is currently in the issue, we don't have enough information to take action. Please reach out if you have more relevant information or answers to our questions so that we can investigate further.

> You could try, locally, to print out what key clef is trying to use on the key. Might be that you stored the wrong password? Just don't post any logs here :)

So clef setpw does not set the password for the given key, but tells clef what the password already is?

I just succeeded at unlocking the account in the geth console, so the cause was my misunderstanding of how this works.

Maybe the documentation could be a bit clearer, since setpw doesn't actually set the password of the key, but stores it in clef, just like you mentioned above.

Anyway, thanks for your detailed walkthrough that allowed me to see this distinction.
@holiman the issue can be closed. Before that, though, I guess the clef documentation about setpw should be updated.

@daosvik how would you better phrase it so it is more understandable?
currently it states: `setpw   Store a credential for a keystore file` in the README and `You can inject an unlock password via `clef setpw`` in the tutorial - if you have a better suggestion please let us know!

I think it would be better if you replace "a credential" with "the password" and "an unlock password" with "the unlock password".
It could also be beneficial to change "for a keystore file" to "for decrypting a keystore file".

@daosvik 
> I just succeeded at unlocking the account in the geth console, so the cause was my misunderstanding of how this works.

Could you write short info how you did it? Cause I'm facing very similar now and could not google the solution. I get same error when ("pass" is replacement for actual password when created the account(s) - both 0 and 1):
```
./geth --datadir.minfreedisk 0 --password "pass" console 2>/dev/null
if (personal.unlockAccount(eth.accounts[0],"pass")) {personal.signTransaction({from: eth.accounts[0], to: eth.accounts[1], value: web3.toWei(0.5, "ether"),nonce: 1, gas: 10, gasPrice: 10})}
```
TIA
P.S. I don't have `clef`, I went to [geth web](https://geth.ethereum.org/) and in downloads for Linux found only archives that have only geth exec file (and license).
@mars4science, testing github message for closed issues.
